title: French President Macron promises Ukraine Mirage aircraft to fend off Russian attacks
summary: During his TV interview on Thursday, Macron also confirmed that Moscow arrested a Frenchman working for a Swiss NGO, and warned that the EU could be 'blocked' by the far right, ahead in the polls for the upcoming European elections.

title: 2024 European elections: Who is running in France?
summary: France will vote on June 9 to elect 81 members of the European Parliament, as the 27 member states of the European Union renew the legislature's 720 seats.

title: Russia 'maps weak spots and dividing lines in target countries'
summary: Incidents targeting Finland, Scandinavia, and the three Baltic countries have multiplied. Experts have taken inventory of them and recommend coordinated action for deterrence.

title: Russia holds Frenchman accused of gathering military information
summary: Laurent Vinatier, who works for a Geneva-based conflict mediation NGO, is also accused of failing to register as a 'foreign agent.' 'We will follow this closely and he will receive all consular protection,' French President Macron said Thursday evening.

title: French Open 2024: Italy's Paolini to play Swiatek in her first Grand Slam final
summary: Jasmine Paolini is through to her first Grand Slam final at the age of 28 after ending the run of 17-year-old Russian sensation Mirra Andreeva.

summary: The new Netflix feature movie turns a shark attack into a moment of truth for the capital's mayor, on the eve of a triathlon.

summary: Hundreds of surviving WWII veterans were joined by world leaders on the Normandy beaches on Thursday for the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings.

title: Russian connections of several far-right MEPs become clearer
summary: Counter-espionage services are investigating three news websites and their links with French and other European elected representatives.

title: Western US baking in extreme early-summer heatwave
summary: Temperatures are reaching 111 degrees Fahrenheit (44 degrees Celsius) in Las Vegas, while in the Death Valley desert, it was expected to shoot past 120F. Experts warn the unseasonably scorching temperatures could signal the start of a brutal summer.

title: 2024 European elections: When do the 27 member states vote?
summary: The Netherlands, which never votes on Sundays, will open the polls on Thursday. In some countries, elections are held over two days, and in Italy, polling stations close at 11 pm on Sunday.

title: The crazy story of the lost Caravaggio, now on display at the Prado
summary: The painting by the Italian artist attracted the attention of collectors worldwide after being discovered in an auction catalogue listed for €1,500.

title: Trump ally Steve Bannon must surrender to prison by July 1
summary: He must serve his four-month sentence for defying a subpoena from the House committee that investigated the US Capitol insurrection, a federal judge ruled Thursday.

title: 'Climate chaos': Planet breaks temperature records for twelfth month in a row
summary: It is now 80% likely that the global average annual temperature will temporarily exceed the 1.5°C warming threshold for at least one of the next five years. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for action.

title: Israel transfers Gazan prisoners from detention center where army is accused of torture
summary: The Israeli army will transfer hundreds of prisoners out of the Sde Teiman military-run detention center after the deaths of 36 detainees there. An Israeli healthworker who was onsite at the center's field hospital told Le Monde he witnessed 'human rights violations.'

title: Who's rich in France? The Inequality Observatory revives the debate
summary: In its latest study, the French organization sets the bar for being rich at an after-tax salary of €3,860 for a single person, and observes that, while there are fewer and fewer such people in France, the rich are getting richer.

title: Starliner at the space station after thruster trouble
summary: Boeing plans to keep the capsule at the ISS for at least eight days before guiding it to a landing in the western US.

title: ECB cuts key rate by quarter point, but raises inflation forecast
summary: The European Central Bank lowered its key deposit rate to 3.75%, in its first interest rate cut since 2019.

title: Putin threatens to supply long-range missiles to other countries to strike the West
summary: During a lengthy press conference, the Russian president suggested that Moscow would supply weapons to other countries, in an attempt to influence the current major talks among Western countries.

title: Ukraine: one year after the destruction of the Kakhovka dam, a report denounces 'an environmental war crime'
summary: On June 6, 2023, an explosion destroyed a huge dam on the Dnipro. Flooding and drought are traumatizing the population.

title: Israeli universities brace for growing threat of boycotts
summary: Western higher education institutions are beginning to suspend relations with their counterparts in Israel, on the grounds that they contribute to the system of occupation and colonization of Palestine.

title: Israel's PM Netanyahu will address US Congress on July 24
summary: The visit comes amid mounting pressure for the US ally and Hamas militants to agree to a permanent ceasefire.

title: Canada: Extreme water rationing in Calgary after a major water pipe broke
summary: A 'critical water supply alert' was issued to mobile phones and broadcasters. The mayor urged to skip 'a shower or a bath.'

title: Romania's Timisoara is a city open to 'European energies'
summary: 'Europe: The benefits of enlargement' (2/5). In recent years, this city in western Romania has experienced spectacular growth, attracting numerous foreign companies. Dominic Fritz, its young German mayor, embodies its openness to the rest of Europe.

title: Paris 2024: Olympics organizers unveil 5 Olympic rings mounted on the Eiffel Tower
summary: To celebrate the 50-day mark before the July 26 to August 11 Summer Games kick off in France's capital, the iconic monument was decorated with a recycled steel display of the the Olympic Games' iconic 5-ring logo.

title: EU elections: Irish & Czechs to vote after Dutch far right gains
summary: On the second day of voting in the four-day marathon election of candidates to the European parliament, Irish and Czech voters head to the polls on Friday in an election  marked by themes of immigration, fears of Russian interference, and a shift to the right.

title: Frenchman's arrest in Moscow constitutes new escalation by Russia
summary: Laurent Vinatier, 48, a representative of a Swiss NGO, was arrested in the Russian capital for failing to declare himself a 'foreign agent.' Paris saw the arrest as a 'message,' in the context of an increasingly tense relationship.

title: War in Ukraine: By sending Mirage fighters, France steps up support for Kyiv
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron announced on Thursday, June 6, that France would send Ukraine Mirage 2000-5s fighter jets. He did not specify the number of fighter jets to be delivered, of which France has a limited number.

title: Rishi Sunak apologizes for leaving D-Day commemorations early
summary: The British prime minister missed the international ceremony in Normandy on Thursday afternoon to return to the UK for an interview about the election campaign.

title: German court drops Zverev domestic abuse case after settlement
summary: Alexander Zverev, who skipped the court proceedings to play at the French Open, found an agreement with his ex-girlfriend to pay €200,000 to state coffers and charitable organizations.

title: Biden draws parallels with Ukraine at D-Day 80th anniversary: 'We will not walk away'
summary: The American president took the opportunity of the D-Day commemorations in Normandy to show their support for Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: French Open: Is it game, set and match for line judges?
summary: In 2025, the Paris Grand Slam is set to dispense with these court-side umpires in favor of an electronic refereeing system, as on the rest of the main men's tennis circuit.

title: Israeli airstrike in central Gaza wipes out shelter in UNRWA school
summary: Nine children were among the 37 people who died in the strike on a UNRWA school-turned-shelter for displaced persons, in the Nuseirat refugee camp. The Israeli government justified its attack by claiming that the shelter was hiding 'a Hamas base.'

title: Zelensky urges West to do more for 'fair peace,' in speech to French parliament
summary: A day after attending the D-Day commemorations in Normandy, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky addressed the Assemblée Nationale with a plea for support.

title: Israel bombs Gaza refugee camp as truce negotiations stall
summary: Just a day after an Israeli strike destroyed a UN-run school, killing at least 37, its army has hammered the nearby Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza. Contradictory statements by different parties, meanwhile, are stalling ceasefire negotiations.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Coca-Cola's mixed messages on single-use plastic
summary: The exclusive drinks distributor at the Paris Olympics is promoting its fountains, returnable cups and glass bottles, but more than 40% of drinks will come in plastic bottles.

title: D-Day: Watch the highlights from the 80th anniversary commemorations
summary: June 6, 2024 marked the 80th anniversary of the WWII Normandy landings. President Emmanuel Macron received some 20 leaders, including Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, at an international ceremony at Omaha Beach.
